alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:57AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Mineral County through 1130 AM PDT... At 1055 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Luning, or 37 miles southwest of Gabbs, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rainfall, blowing dust, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Blowing dust could reduce visibility rapidly. Locations impacted include... Luning, Fletcher, Indian Head Peak and Excelsior Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Blowing dust can be hazardous. Delay or reroute travel. Remain aware of the weather. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
